00001 /* DTrackSDK: C++ source file, A.R.T. GmbH 3.5.07-29.07.11
00002  *
00003  * DTrackSDK: functions to receive and process DTrack UDP packets (ASCII protocol), as
00004  * well as to exchange DTrack2 TCP command strings.
00005  * Copyright (C) 2007-2011, Advanced Realtime Tracking GmbH
00006  *
00007  * This library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
00008  * modify it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public
00009  * License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either
00010  * version 2.1 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.
00011  *
00012  * This library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
00013  * but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
00014  * MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU
00015  * Lesser General Public License for more details.
00016  *
00017  * You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public
00018  * License along with this library; if not, write to the Free Software
00019  * Foundation, Inc., 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307  USA
00020  *
00021  *
00022  * Version v2.1.0
00023  *
00024  * Purpose:
00025  *  - receives DTrack UDP packets (ASCII protocol) and converts them into easier to handle data
00026  *  - sends and receives DTrack2 commands (TCP)
00027  *  - DTrack2 network protocol due to: 'Technical Appendix DTrack v2.0'
00028  *  - for ARTtrack Controller versions v0.2 (and compatible versions)
00029  *  - tested under Linux (gcc) and MS Windows 2000/XP (MS Visual C++)
00030  *
00031  * $Id: DTrackSDK.cpp,v 1.38 2011/08/04 12:38:44 christoph Exp $
00032  */

00097 
00109 void DTrackSDK::init(const std::string server_host,     unsigned short server_port,     unsigned short data_port,
00110         RemoteSystemType remote_type, int data_bufsize, int data_timeout_us, int srv_timeout_us)
00111 {
00112         rsType = remote_type;
00113         int err;
00114 
00115         d_udpsock = NULL;
00116         d_tcpsock = NULL;
00117         d_udpbuf = NULL;
00118 
00119         lastDataError = ERR_NONE;
00120         lastServerError = ERR_NONE;
00121         setLastDTrackError();
00122 
00123         d_udptimeout_us = data_timeout_us;
00124         d_tcptimeout_us = srv_timeout_us;
00125         d_remoteport = server_port;
00126 
00127         net_init();
00128 
00129         // parse remote address if available
00130         d_remote_ip = 0;
00131         if (!server_host.empty()) {
00132                 d_remote_ip = ip_name2ip(server_host.c_str());
00133         }
00134 
00135         // create UDP socket:
00136         d_udpport = data_port;
00137 
00138         if ((d_remote_ip != 0) && (server_port == 0)) { // listen to multicast case
00139                 err = udp_init(&d_udpsock, &d_udpport, d_remote_ip);
00140         } else { // normal case
00141                 err = udp_init(&d_udpsock, &d_udpport);
00142         }
00143         if (err) {
00144                 d_udpsock = NULL;
00145                 d_udpport = 0;
00146                 return;
00147         }
00148 
00149         // create UDP buffer:
00150         d_udpbufsize = data_bufsize;
00151         d_udpbuf = (char *)malloc(data_bufsize);
00152         if (!d_udpbuf) {
00153                 udp_exit(d_udpsock);
00154                 d_udpsock = NULL;
00155                 d_udpport = 0;
00156                 return;
00157         }
00158 
00159         if (d_remote_ip) {
00160                 if (server_port == 0) { // multicast
00161                         d_remoteport = 0;
00162                 } else {
00163                         if (rsType != SYS_DTRACK) {
00164                                 err = tcp_client_init(&d_tcpsock, d_remote_ip, server_port);
00165                                 if (err) {  // no connection to DTrack2 server
00166                                         // on error assuming DTrack if system is unknown
00167                                         if (rsType == SYS_DTRACK_UNKNOWN)
00168                                         {
00169                                                 rsType = SYS_DTRACK;
00170                                                 // DTrack will not listen to tcp port 50105 -> ignore tcp connection
00171                                         }
00172                                 } else {
00173                                         // TCP connection up, should be DTrack2
00174                                         rsType = SYS_DTRACK_2;
00175                                 }
00176                         }
00177                 }
00178         }
00179         // reset actual DTrack data:
00180         act_framecounter = 0;
00181         act_timestamp = -1;
00182 
00183         act_num_body = act_num_flystick = act_num_meatool = act_num_hand = act_num_human = 0;
00184         act_num_marker = 0;
00185 
00186         d_message_origin = "";
00187         d_message_status = "";
00188         d_message_framenr = 0;
00189         d_message_errorid = 0;
00190         d_message_msg = "";
00191 }
00192 
00193 
00197 DTrackSDK::~DTrackSDK()
00198 {
00199         // release buffer
00200         free(d_udpbuf);
00201 
00202         // release sockets & net
00203         if ((d_remote_ip != 0) && (d_remoteport == 0)) {
00204                 udp_exit(d_udpsock, d_remote_ip);
00205         } else {
00206                 udp_exit(d_udpsock);
00207         }
00208         tcp_exit(d_tcpsock);
00209         net_exit();
00210 }

00219 bool DTrackSDK::setDataTimeoutUS(int timeout) {
00220         if (timeout < 1)
00221                 return false;
00222         d_udptimeout_us = timeout;
00223         return true;
00224 }

00233 bool DTrackSDK::setControllerTimeoutUS(int timeout) {
00234         if (timeout < 1)
00235                 return false;
00236         d_tcptimeout_us = timeout;
00237         return true;
00238 }

00316 bool DTrackSDK::isLocalDataPortValid()

00318         return (d_udpsock != NULL);

00329 {

00333 
00340 bool DTrackSDK::receive()
00341 {
00342         char* s;
00343         int i, j, k, l, n, len, id;
00344         char sfmt[20];
00345         int iarr[5];
00346         double d, darr[6];
00347         int loc_num_bodycal, loc_num_handcal, loc_num_flystick1, loc_num_meatool;
00348 
00349         lastDataError = ERR_NONE;
00350         lastServerError = ERR_NONE;
00351 
00352         if (!isLocalDataPortValid()) {
00353                 lastDataError = ERR_NET;
00354                 return false;
00355         }
00356         // defaults:
00357         act_framecounter = 0;
00358         act_timestamp = -1;   // i.e. not available
00359         loc_num_bodycal = loc_num_handcal = -1;  // i.e. not available
00360         loc_num_flystick1 = loc_num_meatool = 0;
00361 
00362         // receive UDP packet:
00363         len = udp_receive(d_udpsock, d_udpbuf, d_udpbufsize-1, d_udptimeout_us);
00364         if (len == -1) {
00365                 lastDataError = ERR_TIMEOUT;
00366                 return false;
00367         }
00368 
00369         if (len <= 0) {
00370                 lastDataError = ERR_NET;
00371                 return false;
00372         }
00373 
00374         s = d_udpbuf;
00375         s[len] = '\0';
00376 
00377         // process lines:
00378         lastDataError = ERR_PARSE;
00379 
00380         do {
00381                 // line for frame counter:
00382                 if (!strncmp(s, "fr ", 3)) {
00383                         s += 3;
00384                         if (!(s = string_get_ui(s, &act_framecounter))) {
00385                                 act_framecounter = 0;
00386                                 return false;
00387                         }
00388                         continue;
00389                 }
00390                 // line for timestamp:
00391                 if (!strncmp(s, "ts ", 3)) {
00392                         s += 3;
00393                         if (!(s = string_get_d(s, &act_timestamp)))     {
00394                                 act_timestamp = -1;
00395                                 return false;
00396                         }
00397                         continue;
00398                 }
00399                 // line for additional information about number of calibrated bodies:
00400                 if (!strncmp(s, "6dcal ", 6)) {
00401                         s += 6;
00402                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &loc_num_bodycal))) {
00403                                 return false;
00404                         }
00405                         continue;
00406                 }
00407                 // line for standard body data:
00408                 if (!strncmp(s, "6d ", 3)) {
00409                         s += 3;
00410                         // disable all existing dataargc != 2
00411                         for (i=0; i<act_num_body; i++) {
00412                                 memset(&act_body[i], 0, sizeof(DTrack_Body_Type));
00413                                 act_body[i].id = i;
00414                                 act_body[i].quality = -1;
00415                         }
00416                         // get number of standard bodies (in line)
00417                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &n))) {
00418                                 return false;
00419                         }
00420                         // get data of standard bodies
00421                         for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
00422                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "id", &id, NULL, &d))) {
00423                                         return false;
00424                                 }
00425                                 // adjust length of vector
00426                                 if (id >= act_num_body) {
00427                                         act_body.resize(id + 1);
00428                                         for (j = act_num_body; j<=id; j++) {
00429                                                 memset(&act_body[j], 0, sizeof(DTrack_Body_Type));
00430                                                 act_body[j].id = j;
00431                                                 act_body[j].quality = -1;
00432                                         }
00433                                         act_num_body = id + 1;
00434                                 }
00435                                 act_body[id].id = id;
00436                                 act_body[id].quality = d;
00437                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddd", NULL, NULL, act_body[id].loc))) {
00438                                         return false;
00439                                 }
00440                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddddddddd", NULL, NULL, act_body[id].rot))) {
00441                                         return false;
00442                                 }
00443                         }
00444                         continue;
00445                 }
00446 
00447                 // line for Flystick data (older format):
00448                 if (!strncmp(s, "6df ", 4)) {
00449                         s += 4;
00450                         // get number of calibrated Flysticks
00451                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &n))) {
00452                                 return false;
00453                         }
00454                         loc_num_flystick1 = n;
00455                         // adjust length of vector
00456                         if (n != act_num_flystick) {
00457                                 act_flystick.resize(n);
00458                                 act_num_flystick = n;
00459                         }
00460                         // get data of Flysticks
00461                         for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
00462                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "idi", iarr, NULL, &d))) {
00463                                         return false;
00464                                 }
00465                                 if (iarr[0] != i) {     // not expected
00466                                         return false;
00467                                 }
00468                                 act_flystick[i].id = iarr[0];
00469                                 act_flystick[i].quality = d;
00470                                 act_flystick[i].num_button = 8;
00471                                 k = iarr[1];
00472                                 for (j=0; j<8; j++) {
00473                                         act_flystick[i].button[j] = k & 0x01;
00474                                         k >>= 1;
00475                                 }
00476                                 act_flystick[i].num_joystick = 2;  // additionally to buttons 5-8
00477                                 if (iarr[1] & 0x20) {
00478                                         act_flystick[i].joystick[0] = -1;
00479                                 } else
00480                                 if (iarr[1] & 0x80) {
00481                                         act_flystick[i].joystick[0] = 1;
00482                                 } else {
00483                                         act_flystick[i].joystick[0] = 0;
00484                                 }
00485                                 if(iarr[1] & 0x10){
00486                                         act_flystick[i].joystick[1] = -1;
00487                                 }else if(iarr[1] & 0x40){
00488                                         act_flystick[i].joystick[1] = 1;
00489                                 }else{
00490                                         act_flystick[i].joystick[1] = 0;
00491                                 }
00492                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddd", NULL, NULL, act_flystick[i].loc))) {
00493                                         return false;
00494                                 }
00495                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddddddddd", NULL, NULL, act_flystick[i].rot))) {
00496                                         return false;
00497                                 }
00498                         }
00499                         continue;
00500                 }
00501 
00502                 // line for Flystick data (newer format):
00503                 if (!strncmp(s, "6df2 ", 5)) {
00504                         s += 5;
00505                         // get number of calibrated Flysticks
00506                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &n))) {
00507                                 return false;
00508                         }
00509                         // adjust length of vector
00510                         if (n != act_num_flystick) {
00511                                 act_flystick.resize(n);
00512                                 act_num_flystick = n;
00513                         }
00514                         // get number of Flysticks
00515                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &n))) {
00516                                 return false;
00517                         }
00518                         // get data of Flysticks
00519                         for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
00520                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "idii", iarr, NULL, &d))) {
00521                                         return false;
00522                                 }
00523                                 if (iarr[0] != i) {  // not expected
00524                                         return false;
00525                                 }
00526                                 act_flystick[i].id = iarr[0];
00527                                 act_flystick[i].quality = d;
00528                                 if ((iarr[1] > DTRACK_FLYSTICK_MAX_BUTTON)||(iarr[1] > DTRACK_FLYSTICK_MAX_JOYSTICK)) {
00529                                         return false;
00530                                 }
00531                                 act_flystick[i].num_button = iarr[1];
00532                                 act_flystick[i].num_joystick = iarr[2];
00533                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddd", NULL, NULL, act_flystick[i].loc))){
00534                                         return false;
00535                                 }
00536                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddddddddd", NULL, NULL, act_flystick[i].rot))){
00537                                         return false;
00538                                 }
00539                                 strcpy(sfmt, "");
00540                                 j = 0;
00541                                 while (j < act_flystick[i].num_button) {
00542                                         strcat(sfmt, "i");
00543                                         j += 32;
00544                                 }
00545                                 j = 0;
00546                                 while (j < act_flystick[i].num_joystick) {
00547                                         strcat(sfmt, "d");
00548                                         j++;
00549                                 }
00550                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, sfmt, iarr, NULL, act_flystick[i].joystick))) {
00551                                         return false;
00552                                 }
00553                                 k = l = 0;
00554                                 for (j=0; j<act_flystick[i].num_button; j++) {
00555                                         act_flystick[i].button[j] = iarr[k] & 0x01;
00556                                         iarr[k] >>= 1;
00557                                         l++;
00558                                         if (l == 32) {
00559                                                 k++;
00560                                                 l = 0;
00561                                         }
00562                                 }
00563                         }
00564                         continue;
00565                 }
00566 
00567                 // line for measurement tool data:
00568                 if (!strncmp(s, "6dmt ", 5)) {
00569                         s += 5;
00570                         // get number of calibrated measurement tools
00571                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &n))) {
00572                                 return false;
00573                         }
00574                         loc_num_meatool = n;
00575                         // adjust length of vector
00576                         if (n != act_num_meatool) {
00577                                 act_meatool.resize(n);
00578                                 act_num_meatool = n;
00579                         }
00580                         // get data of measurement tools
00581                         for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
00582                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "idi", iarr, NULL, &d))) {
00583                                         return false;
00584                                 }
00585                                 if (iarr[0] != i) {  // not expected
00586                                         return false;
00587                                 }
00588                                 act_meatool[i].id = iarr[0];
00589                                 act_meatool[i].quality = d;
00590                                 act_meatool[i].num_button = 1;
00591                                 act_meatool[i].button[0] = iarr[1] & 0x01;
00592                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddd", NULL, NULL, act_meatool[i].loc))) {
00593                                         return false;
00594                                 }
00595                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddddddddd", NULL, NULL, act_meatool[i].rot))) {
00596                                         return false;
00597                                 }
00598                         }
00599                         continue;
00600                 }
00601 
00602                 // line for additional information about number of calibrated Fingertracking hands:
00603                 if (!strncmp(s, "glcal ", 6)) {
00604                         s += 6;
00605                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &loc_num_handcal))) { // get number of calibrated hands
00606                                 return false;
00607                         }
00608                 }
00609 
00610                 // line for A.R.T. Fingertracking hand data:
00611                 if (!strncmp(s, "gl ", 3)) {
00612                         s += 3;
00613                         // disable all existing data
00614                         for (i=0; i<act_num_hand; i++) {
00615                                 memset(&act_hand[i], 0, sizeof(DTrack_Hand_Type));
00616                                 act_hand[i].id = i;
00617                                 act_hand[i].quality = -1;
00618                         }
00619                         // get number of hands (in line)
00620                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &n))) {
00621                                 return false;
00622                         }
00623                         // get data of hands
00624                         for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
00625                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "idii", iarr, NULL, &d))){
00626                                         return false;
00627                                 }
00628                                 id = iarr[0];
00629                                 if (id >= act_num_hand) {  // adjust length of vector
00630                                         act_hand.resize(id + 1);
00631                                         for (j=act_num_hand; j<=id; j++) {
00632                                                 memset(&act_hand[j], 0, sizeof(DTrack_Hand_Type));
00633                                                 act_hand[j].id = j;
00634                                                 act_hand[j].quality = -1;
00635                                         }
00636                                         act_num_hand = id + 1;
00637                                 }
00638                                 act_hand[id].id = iarr[0];
00639                                 act_hand[id].lr = iarr[1];
00640                                 act_hand[id].quality = d;
00641                                 if (iarr[2] > DTRACK_HAND_MAX_FINGER) {
00642                                         return false;
00643                                 }
00644                                 act_hand[id].nfinger = iarr[2];
00645                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddd", NULL, NULL, act_hand[id].loc))) {
00646                                         return false;
00647 
00648                                 }
00649                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddddddddd", NULL, NULL, act_hand[id].rot))){
00650                                         return false;
00651                                 }
00652                                 // get data of fingers
00653                                 for (j = 0; j < act_hand[id].nfinger; j++) {
00654                                         if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddd", NULL, NULL, act_hand[id].finger[j].loc))) {
00655                                                 return false;
00656                                         }
00657                                         if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddddddddd", NULL, NULL, act_hand[id].finger[j].rot))){
00658                                                 return false;
00659                                         }
00660                                         if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "dddddd", NULL, NULL, darr))){
00661                                                 return false;
00662                                         }
00663                                         act_hand[id].finger[j].radiustip = darr[0];
00664                                         act_hand[id].finger[j].lengthphalanx[0] = darr[1];
00665                                         act_hand[id].finger[j].anglephalanx[0] = darr[2];
00666                                         act_hand[id].finger[j].lengthphalanx[1] = darr[3];
00667                                         act_hand[id].finger[j].anglephalanx[1] = darr[4];
00668                                         act_hand[id].finger[j].lengthphalanx[2] = darr[5];
00669                                 }
00670                         }
00671                         continue;
00672                 }
00673 
00674                 // line for 6dj human model data
00675                 if (!strncmp(s, "6dj ", 4)) {
00676                         s += 4;
00677 
00678                         // get number of calibrated human models
00679                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &n))) { 
00680                                 return false;    
00681                         }
00682                         // adjust length of vector
00683                         if(n != act_num_human){
00684                                 act_human.resize(n);
00685                                 act_num_human = n;
00686                         }
00687                         for(i=0; i<act_num_human; i++){
00688                                 memset(&act_human[i], 0, sizeof(DTrack_Human_Type));
00689                                 act_human[i].id = i;
00690                                 act_human[i].num_joints = 0;
00691                         }
00692                         
00693                         // get number of human models
00694                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &n))) { 
00695                                 return false;
00696                         }
00697                         int id_human;
00698                         for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
00699                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ii", iarr, NULL,NULL))){
00700                                         return false;
00701                                 }
00702                                 if (iarr[0] > act_num_human - 1) // not expected
00703                                         return false;
00704 
00705                                 id_human = iarr[0];
00706                                 act_human[id_human].id = iarr[0];
00707                                 act_human[id_human].num_joints = iarr[1];
00708 
00709                                 for (j = 0; j < iarr[1]; j++){
00710                                         if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "id", &id, NULL, &d))){
00711                                                 return false;
00712                                         }
00713                                         act_human[id_human].joint[j].id = id;
00714                                         act_human[id_human].joint[j].quality = d;
00715 
00716                                         if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "dddddd", NULL, NULL, darr))){
00717                                                 return false;
00718                                         }
00719                                         memcpy(act_human[id_human].joint[j].loc, &darr,  3*sizeof(double));
00720                                         memcpy(act_human[id_human].joint[j].ang, &darr[3],  3*sizeof(double));
00721 
00722                                         if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddddddddd", NULL, NULL, act_human[id_human].joint[j].rot))){
00723                                                 return false;
00724                                         }
00725                                 }
00726                         }
00727                         continue;
00728                 }
00729 
00730                 // line for single marker data:
00731                 if (!strncmp(s, "3d ", 3)) {
00732                         s += 3;
00733                         // get number of markers
00734                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &act_num_marker))) {
00735                                 act_num_marker = 0;
00736                                 return false;
00737                         }
00738                         if (act_num_marker > (int )act_marker.size()) {
00739                                 act_marker.resize(act_num_marker);
00740                         }
00741                         // get data of single markers
00742                         for (i=0; i<act_num_marker; i++) {
00743                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "id", &act_marker[i].id, NULL, &act_marker[i].quality))) {
00744                                         return false;
00745                                 }
00746                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddd", NULL, NULL, act_marker[i].loc))) {
00747                                         return false;
00748                                 }
00749                         }
00750                         continue;
00751                 }
00752 
00753                 // ignore unknown line identifiers (could be valid in future DTracks)
00754         } while((s = string_nextline(d_udpbuf, s, d_udpbufsize)));
00755 
00756         // set number of calibrated standard bodies, if necessary:
00757         if (loc_num_bodycal >= 0) {     // '6dcal' information was available
00758                 n = loc_num_bodycal - loc_num_flystick1 - loc_num_meatool;
00759                 if (n > act_num_body) {  // adjust length of vector
00760                         act_body.resize(n);
00761                         for (j=act_num_body; j<n; j++) {
00762                                 memset(&act_body[j], 0, sizeof(DTrack_Body_Type));
00763                                 act_body[j].id = j;
00764                                 act_body[j].quality = -1;
00765                         }
00766                 }
00767                 act_num_body = n;
00768         }
00769 
00770         // set number of calibrated Fingertracking hands, if necessary:
00771         if (loc_num_handcal >= 0) {  // 'glcal' information was available
00772                 if (loc_num_handcal > act_num_hand) {  // adjust length of vector
00773                         act_hand.resize(loc_num_handcal);
00774                         for (j=act_num_hand; j<loc_num_handcal; j++) {
00775                                 memset(&act_hand[j], 0, sizeof(DTrack_Hand_Type));
00776                                 act_hand[j].id = j;
00777                                 act_hand[j].quality = -1;
00778                         }
00779                 }
00780                 act_num_hand = loc_num_handcal;
00781         }
00782 
00783         lastDataError = ERR_NONE;
00784         return true;
00785 }
00786

00796         return act_num_body;
00797 }

00973 
00981 bool DTrackSDK::sendCommand(const std::string command)
00982 {
00983         if (!isLocalDataPortValid())
00984                 return false;
00985         lastDataError = ERR_NONE;
00986         // dest is dtrack2
00987         if (rsType == SYS_DTRACK_2)     {
00988                 // command style is dtrack?
00989                 if (0 == strncmp(command.c_str(), "dtrack ", 7)) {
00990                         std::string c = command.substr(7);
00991                         // start measurement
00992                         if (0 == strncmp(c.c_str(), "10 3",4)) {
00993                                 return startMeasurement();
00994                         }
00995                         // stop measurement
00996                         if (    (0 == strncmp(c.c_str(), "10 0",4))
00997                                 ||      (0 == strncmp(c.c_str(), "10 1",4)))
00998                         {
00999                                 return stopMeasurement();
01000                         }
01001                         // simulate success of other old commands
01002                         return true;
01003                 }
01004         }
01005         if (udp_send(d_udpsock, (void*)command.c_str(), (unsigned int)command.length() + 1, d_remote_ip, d_remoteport, d_udptimeout_us))
01006         {
01007                 lastDataError = ERR_NET;
01008                 return false;
01009         }
01010         if (strcmp(command.c_str(), "dtrack 10 3") == 0) {
01011         #ifdef OS_UNIX
01012                 sleep(1);     // some delay (actually only necessary for older DTrack versions...)
01013         #endif
01014         #ifdef OS_WIN
01015                 Sleep(1000);  // some delay (actually only necessary for older DTrack versions...)
01016         #endif
01017         }
01018         return true;
01019 }
01020 
01021 
01036 int DTrackSDK::sendDTrack2Command(const std::string command, std::string *answer)
01037 {
01038         // Params via TCP are not supported in DTrack
01039         if (rsType != SYS_DTRACK_2)
01040                 return -2;
01041 
01042         // reset dtrack error
01043         setLastDTrackError();
01044 
01045         // command too long?
01046         if (command.length() > DTRACK_PROT_MAXLEN) {
01047                 lastServerError = ERR_NET;
01048                 return -3;
01049         }
01050 
01051         // connection invalid
01052         if (!isCommandInterfaceValid()) {
01053                 lastServerError = ERR_NET;
01054                 return -10;
01055         }
01056 
01057         // send TCP command string:
01058         if ((tcp_send(d_tcpsock, command.c_str(), command.length() + 1, d_tcptimeout_us))) {
01059                 lastServerError = ERR_NET;
01060                 return -11;
01061         }
01062 
01063         // receive TCP response string:
01064         char ans[DTRACK_PROT_MAXLEN];
01065         int err;
01066         if ((err = tcp_receive(d_tcpsock, ans, DTRACK_PROT_MAXLEN, d_tcptimeout_us)) < 0) {
01067 
01068                 if (err == -1) {        // timeout
01069                         lastServerError = ERR_TIMEOUT;
01070                 }
01071                 else
01072                 if (err == -9) {        // broken connection
01073                         tcp_exit(d_tcpsock);
01074                         d_tcpsock = NULL;
01075                 }
01076                 else
01077                         lastServerError = ERR_NET;      // network error
01078 
01079                 if (answer)
01080                         *answer = "";
01081 
01082                 return err;
01083         }
01084 
01085         // parse answer:
01086 
01087         // check for "dtrack2 ok" / no error
01088         if (0 == strcmp(ans, "dtrack2 ok"))
01089                 return 1;
01090 
01091         // got error msg?
01092         if (0 == strncmp(ans, "dtrack2 err ", 12)) {
01093                 char *s = ans + 12;
01094                 int i;
01095 
01096                 // parse error code
01097                 if (!(s = string_get_i((char *)s, &i))) {
01098                         setLastDTrackError(-1100, "SDK error -1100");
01099                         lastServerError = ERR_PARSE;
01100                         return -1100;
01101                 }
01102                 lastDTrackError = i;
01103 
01104                 // parse error string
01105                 if (!(s = string_get_quoted_text((char *)s, lastDTrackErrorString))) {
01106                         setLastDTrackError(-1100, "SDK error -1100");
01107                         lastServerError = ERR_PARSE;
01108                         return -1101;
01109                 }
01110 
01111                 return 2;
01112         }
01113 
01114         // not 'dtrack2 ok'/'dtrack2 err ..' -> return msg
01115         if (answer)
01116                 *answer = ans;
01117 
01118         lastServerError = ERR_NONE;
01119         return 0;
01120 }

01136 
01143 bool DTrackSDK::setParam(const std::string parameter)
01144 {
01145         // send command, 1 means answer "dtrack2 ok"
01146         return (1 == sendDTrack2Command("dtrack2 set " + parameter));
01147 }

01149 
01158 bool DTrackSDK::getParam(const std::string category, const std::string name, std::string& value)
01159 {
01160         return getParam(category + " " + name, value);
01161 }
01162 
01163 
01171 bool DTrackSDK::getParam(const std::string parameter, std::string& value)
01172 {
01173         // Params via TCP are not supported in DTrack
01174         if (rsType != SYS_DTRACK_2)
01175                 return false;
01176 
01177         std::string res;
01178         // expected answer is "dtrack2 set" -> return value 0
01179         if (0 != sendDTrack2Command("dtrack2 get " + parameter, &res))
01180                 return false;
01181 
01182         // parse parameter from answer
01183         if (0 == strncmp(res.c_str(), "dtrack2 set ", 12)) {
01184                 char *str = strdup(res.c_str() + 12);
01185                 char *s = str;
01186                 if (!(s = string_cmp_parameter(s, parameter.c_str()))) {
01187                         free(str);
01188                         lastServerError = ERR_PARSE;
01189                         return false;
01190                 }
01191 
01192                 // assign result
01193                 value = s;
01194                 free(str);
01195                 return true;
01196         }
01197 
01198         return false;
01199 }
01200 
01201 
01208 bool DTrackSDK::getMessage()
01209 {
01210         // Messages via TCP are not supported in DTrack
01211         if (rsType != SYS_DTRACK_2)
01212                 return false;
01213 
01214         // send request
01215         std::string res;
01216         if (0 != sendDTrack2Command("dtrack2 getmsg", &res))
01217                 return false;
01218 
01219         // check answer
01220         if (0 != strncmp(res.c_str(), "dtrack2 msg ", 12))
01221                 return false;
01222 
01223         // reset values
01224         d_message_origin = d_message_msg = d_message_status = "";
01225         d_message_framenr = d_message_errorid = 0;
01226 
01227         // parse message
01228         const char* s = res.c_str() + 12;
01229         // get 'origin'
01230         if (!(s = string_get_word((char *)s, d_message_origin)))
01231                 return false;
01232 
01233         // get 'status'
01234         if (!(s = string_get_word((char *)s, d_message_status)))
01235                         return false;
01236 
01237         unsigned int ui;
01238         // get 'frame counter'
01239         if(!(s = string_get_ui((char *)s, &ui)))
01240                 return false;
01241         d_message_framenr = ui;
01242 
01243         // get 'error id'
01244         if(!(s = string_get_ui((char *)s, &ui)))
01245                 return false;
01246         d_message_errorid = ui;
01247 
01248         // get 'message'
01249         if(!(s = string_get_quoted_text((char *)s, d_message_msg)))
01250                 return false;
01251 
01252         return true;
01253 }

01320 
01327 bool DTrackSDK::startMeasurement()
01328 {
01329         // Check for special DTrack handling
01330         if (rsType == SYS_DTRACK) {
01331                 return (sendCommand("dtrack 10 3")) && (sendCommand("dtrack 31"));
01332         }
01333 
01334         // start tracking, 1 means answer "dtrack2 ok"
01335         return (1 == sendDTrack2Command("dtrack2 tracking start"));
01336 }
01337 
01338 
01344 bool DTrackSDK::stopMeasurement()
01345 {
01346         // Check for special DTrack handling
01347         if (rsType == SYS_DTRACK) {
01348                 return (sendCommand("dtrack 32")) && (sendCommand("dtrack 10 0"));
01349         }
01350 
01351         // stop tracking, 1 means answer "dtrack2 ok"
01352         return (1 == sendDTrack2Command("dtrack2 tracking stop"));
01353 }
